1.title: Black Sabbath

11.content:
#1: Layne
Freshman year, 6' 0"
Having moved south to Los Chupacabras from from the taiga forests of the north, little is known about this human. Some say that, as an infant, he was swallowed by a bear and clawed his way out to be adopted and raised by an amarok. But, he is better known as Layne, the tall, lanky and happy-go-lucky human who likes to thrash. After spending time with new friends in his new home, his cynicism began to blossom and he decided to try out for the Hall Monitors so he could find a constructive way to use his newfound bitterness.

#2: Joss "the Boss"
Junior year, 5' 10"
Joss has always been capable of handling himself physically. His title "Boss" came from the admiration of his human peers growing up, but in high school, with monsters ready to put a proud human back in place, he goes by "Joss". Though he is only a powerless human, Joss has a lot of determination backing a huge ego to fuel his power of will as he aims to win back his right to be called "Boss" in the ranks of the Hall Monitors. He failed two years in a row to reach the requisites of becoming one of the few humans on the team, but with two senior humans gone, he has high hopes this time...

#3: "Rockey" Rolf
Senior year, 6' 4"
Tall, blonde and handsome, Rolf is the kind of guy who the ladies faun over, human or other, but when he puts on the shades and strolls down the halls, he's the strong arm of the school. And he has the size, the inhuman strength and durability to back up his claims to fame. Who needs the varsity when you can patrol the school halls? Having been a hallway monitor since his sophomore year, Rolf holds the record for the longest serving human hall monitor and is the sole senior member this year.

12.title: Children of the Grave, II

14.content: You can tell by the look in their eyes. The feeling comes as no surprise. Another place is about to die...
14.title: GRRL!school

info.brief_description: Humans, anthros, and monsters walk these halls. It's your job to keep them in line.
info.description:
This is the city of Los Chupacabras, California (totally NOT Los Angeles!), humans, monsters, and anthros alike walk the streets and same goes for the halls of Acacia High School. With a student attendance way over 9,000, Acacia needs rough personell--human, anthro, and monster alike--to keep the nerds and the jocks, the preppies and the punks, the spell-chuckers, the hayseeds, the Legion of the Dead, and the glee club--EVERYONE!--from tearing themselves apart.

Let them have no fear now that you're on the job!

Disclaimer: the contents of this interactive has been rated 18+ and may not be suitable for children or furries.

This Interactive has been Rated M for Metal by the Interactive Literature Association of America(TM) Wimps and Posers, leave these halls!

WARNING: THE SURGEON GENERAL HAS DETERMINED THAT HEAVY METAL IS DANGEROUS TO YOUR HEALTH.

The Cage of Ragers ▼
Humans: Cirrie U., Hallie, Joss, Layne, Rockey, Roxanne, (+3 or 4)

Monsters: Adrian (SOS), Ashley K., Brett Lacuna, Bruce Samson, Deaffy Wulfmann, Eddie Head, Johnny Reale, Kate Geoff, Liam Snaggletooth, Stace Quattro, Swan Belladonna, (+19)
